fields.name: location_ping_id
fields.title: ID referencing vehicle_locations.location_ping_id
fields.description: Identifies a vehicle_location that is the location where the passenger_event occurred

fields.name: trip_id_performed
fields.title: ID referencing trips_performed.trip_id_performed
fields.description: Identifies the trip performed. If trips_performed table is used, this must be populated in order to link to it.

fields.name: trip_stop_sequence
fields.title: Positive integer referencing stop_visits.trip_stop_sequence
fields.description:
The actual order of stops visited within a performed trip. The values must start at 1 and must be consecutive along the trip.
Example: A bus departs the first stop and detours around the second and third scheduled stops, visiting one unscheduled stop and resuming regular service at the 4th scheduled stop. The `scheduled_stop_sequence` is [1, null, 4], and the `trip_stop_sequence` is [1, 2, 3].

fields.name: scheduled_stop_sequence
fields.title: positive integer referencing GTFS stop_times.stop_sequence
fields.description: Scheduled order of stops for a particular trip. The values must increase along the trip but do not need to be consecutive. References GTFS

fields.name: event_type
fields.description: Indicates the type of event recorded.

fields.name: device_id
fields.title: ID referencing devices.device_id
fields.description: Identifies the device that recorded the event. May be null if only a single device is reporting passenger events on a vehicle/ train car and the device_id is not distinct from vehicle_id/train_car_id.

fields.name: stop_id
fields.title: ID referencing GTFS stops.stop_id
fields.description: Identifies the stop the vehicle is serving. References GTFS

fields.name: pattern_id
fields.title: unique identifier for the route-pattern
fields.description: Identifies the unique stop-path for a trip, may be distinct from GTFS shapes.shape_id

fields.name: event_count
fields.title: Event count
fields.description: Count for this event, e.g., 3 for a Passenger Boarding event with 3 boardings, default is  `1`

name: passenger_events.schema.json
description: Timestamped passenger-related events, including boardings and alightings.
